page.title: 01General review of block.
page.content: Our block is a rural one,in which the land is mainly used for arable farming.The busy A19 passes through it,linking the nearby towns of York and Selby.The only village contained within it is Escrick,a small community which has fought to maintain its character and which is determined not to become an over-spill of either York or Selby.Most of the land belongs to Escrick Estate.Topics we have entered into our survey text include leisure,sport and recreation,education -in both the state and independent sectors,life-style,trade,employment, religion,law,farming - both dairy and arable,ecology,local issues,children's games,housing and a brief summary of the role of Escrick Estate,both past and present.
